item.title: After severe weather across the South, East Coast braces for potential flooding, tornadoes
item.description: A swath of the eastern U.S. braced for more severe weather after deadly storms knocked out power to hundreds of thousands across the South and disrupted airport travel in the Northeast.

item.title: Israeli airstrike kills dozens in Rafah; raw milk under scrutiny
item.description: At least 35 people were killed and dozens more injured in an Israeli airstrike on an encampment in Rafah. As bird flu spreads among dairy cattle herds, raw milk is undergoing renewed scrutiny.

item.title: The new obesity drugs work, but it's a dilemma when people have to stop taking them
item.description: There are lots of reasons people have to stop taking the new weight loss drugs: cost, shortages, side effects and life events. And the weight usually comes back, doctors say.

item.title: Questions of Loyalty in Latvia
item.description: Russia's war in Ukraine is deepening divisions across Europe. One example is the Baltic nation of Latvia, formerly part of the Soviet Union. One third of those living in Latvia are Russian speaking and now some elderly residents, who may have lived there for decades, are being forced to prove their loyalty or leave.
